reference.title: grayscale
reference.shortdesc: Grayscale colors in Figma create neutral-toned versions of colored vectors and graphics and aid in accessibility testing of designs to ensure UI constrast remains consistent.

section.title: Definition
section.p: Grayscaled graphics and images only contain shades of black, white and gray. By sticking with black and white, form, contrast, and fundamental elements like lineand shape are emphasized.
